description:
Two realms exist in the ancient land of Yanato: the Lofty Realm, where gods reside, and the Lowly Realm, where humans reside. Princess Sakuna was the daughter of the god of war and goddess of harvest, but she led a lazy life. One day, she is banished to Hinoe Island, the Isle of Demons. Stranded in a barren land, Sakuna sets out to slay demons and farm rice. Her new adventure begins!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #天穂のサクナヒメ #サクナヒメ

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Horticulture
tags.description: The story prominently features plant care and gardening.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

node.description: Stared his career at [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/Studio-Live). One of the founding members of [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/PA-Works), he is currently Head of the Animation Department at the studio. He became close with [Kenji Kamiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/100348/Kenji-Kamiyama) while working on The Hakkenden, with the two working together on [Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/467/Ghost-in-the-Shell-Stand-Alone-Complex/) where Yoshihara directed the episodes outsourced to P.A. Works. He had his debut as Director with [The Eccentric Family](https://anilist.co/anime/17909/The-Eccentric-Family/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/horiken2000)

Founder and representative director of [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__[Official Site](https://ikimonogakari.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCflAJoghlGeSkdz5eNIl-sg)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/IKIMONOofficial)__

__ikimono-gakari__ (いきものがかり) is a Japanese rock band. They record on Sony Music Japan's EPIC Records label.  The band was formed in Kanagawa Prefecture in February 1999 by Hotaka Yamashita and [Yoshiki Mizuno](https://anilist.co/staff/168854/Yoshiki-Mizuno), and was later joined by lead vocalist [Kiyoe Yoshioka](https://anilist.co/staff/159004) in December the same year. Hotaka Yamashita later left the band as of July 2021.

__Current members:__
• __芹奈__ - Serina Hasegawa (長谷川芹奈) born June 1, 1998.
• __アサヒ__ - Asahi Kobayashi (小林あさひ) born May 13, 1999.
• __MAYU__ - Mayu Yoshida (吉田真悠) born September 12, 1999.
• __かれん__ - Karen Koga (古賀かれん) born June 8, 1998.
• __manaka__ - Manaka Fukumoto (福本まなか) born December 5, 2000.

__Former members:__
• __YUKA__ - Yuka Sakamoto (坂本有香) born April 20, 1999, graduated October 2013.
• __LINA__ - Lina Yoshimura (吉村リナ)born June 24, 1999, graduated July 2013.
• __麻珠__ - Maju Arai (荒井麻珠)born April 25, 1998, graduated on June 30, 2017.
__Keiji Oota__ is a Japanese producer and animation planner. Managing Director at Toho.
